alert.note: Alert for Citrus; Hernando; Sumter (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 12:05AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Florida and west central Florida, including the following counties, in central Florida, Sumter. In west central Florida, Citrus and Hernando. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1204 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over parts of the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brooksville, Wildwood, Bushnell, Hill n Dale, North Brooksville, South Brooksville, Lake Panasoffkee, Ridge Manor, Center Hill, Webster, Coleman, Wahoo, Nobleton, Istachatta, Croom, Sumterville, Floral City, Suburban Acres, Lake Lindsey and Adamsville. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
